intro: Thouinia inaequalis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces a capsule fruit containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Thouinia inaequalis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
